009
010package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D50;
013import static imagingbook.common.color.colorspace.StandardIlluminant.D65;
014
015import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
016
017import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
018
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This class implements the CIELab color space.
023 * See Sec. 14.2 of [1] for additional details.
024 * All component values are assumed to be in [0,1].
025 * Conversion from/to sRGB is implemented directly through D65-based XYZ
026 * coordinates, i.e., without conversion to Java's D50-based profile 
027 * connection space. The methods fromCIEXYZ/toCIEXYZ still return D50-based XYZ 
028 * coordinates in Java's profile connection space.
029 * This is a singleton class with no public constructors,
030 * use {@link #getInstance()} to obtain the single instance.
031 * </p>
032 * <p>
033 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
034 * </p>
035 * 
036 * @author WB
037 * @version 2022/09/01
038 */
039@SuppressWarnings("serial")
040public class LabColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
041        
042        private static final LabColorSpace instance = new LabColorSpace();
043        
044        public static LabColorSpace getInstance() {
045                return instance;
046        }
047
048        // D65 reference white point:
049//      private static final double Xref = D65.getX();  // 0.950456
050//      private static final double Yref = D65.getY();  // 1.000000
051//      private static final double Zref = D65.getZ();  // 1.088754
052        private static final double[] XYZref = D65.getXYZ();
053
054        // chromatic adaptation objects:
055        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD65toD50 = new BradfordAdaptation(D65, D50);
056        private static final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toD65 = new BradfordAdaptation(D50, D65);
057
058        
059        /**
060         * Constructor.
061         */
062        private LabColorSpace() {
063                super(TYPE_Lab, 3);
064        }
065
066        // XYZ50 -> CIELab: returns Lab values from XYZ (relative to D50)
067        /**
068         * Converts color points in D50-based XYZ space to CIELab coordinates.
069         * This method implements {@link ColorSpace#fromCIEXYZ(float[])}), assuming that 
070         * the specified color coordinate is in D50-based XYZ space (with components in [0,1]).
071         * See also {@link #fromCIEXYZ65(float[])} for a D65-based version.
072         * 
073         * @param XYZ50 a color in D50-based XYZ space (components in [0,1])
074         * @return the associated CIELab color
075         */
076        @Override
077        public float[] fromCIEXYZ(float[] XYZ50) {      
078                float[] XYZ65 = catD50toD65.applyTo(XYZ50);     
079                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
080        }
081
082        // XYZ65 -> CIELab: returns Lab values from XYZ (relative to D65)
083        /**
084         * Converts color points in D65-based XYZ space to CIELab coordinates.
085         * See also {@link #fromCIEXYZ(float[])}.
086         * @param XYZ65 a color in D65-based XYZ space (components in [0,1])
087         * @return the associated CIELab color
088         */
089        public float[] fromCIEXYZ65(float[] XYZ65) {
090                double xx = f1(XYZ65[0] / XYZref[0]);   
091                double yy = f1(XYZ65[1] / XYZref[1]);
092                double zz = f1(XYZ65[2] / XYZref[2]);
093                float L = (float)(116.0 * yy - 16.0);
094                float a = (float)(500.0 * (xx - yy));
095                float b = (float)(200.0 * (yy - zz));
096                return new float[] {L, a, b};
097        }
098
099        // CIELab -> XYZ50: returns XYZ values (relative to D50) from Lab
100        /**
101         * Converts the specified CIELab color to D50-based XYZ coordinates.
102         * This method implements {@link ColorSpace#toCIEXYZ(float[])}) assuming that
103         * the XYZ color coordinate is D50-based.
104         * See also {@link #toCIEXYZ65(float[])} for a D65-based version.
105         * @param Lab CIELab color
106         * @return XYZ coordinates (D50-based)
107         */
108        @Override
109        public float[] toCIEXYZ(float[] Lab) {
110                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Lab);
111                return catD65toD50.applyTo(XYZ65);
112        }
113
114        // CIELab -> XYZ65: returns XYZ values (relative to D65) from Lab
115        /**
116         * Converts the specified CIELab color to D65-based XYZ coordinates.
117         * @param Lab CIELab color
118         * @return XYZ coordinates (D65-based)
119         */
120        public float[] toCIEXYZ65(float[] Lab) {
121                double ll = ( Lab[0] + 16.0 ) / 116.0;
122                float Y65 = (float) (XYZref[1] * f2(ll));
123                float X65 = (float) (XYZref[0] * f2(ll + Lab[1] / 500.0));
124                float Z65 = (float) (XYZref[2] * f2(ll - Lab[2] / 200.0));
125                return new float[] {X65, Y65, Z65};
126        }
127
128        //sRGB -> CIELab (direct, without adaptation to D50)
129        /**
130         * Transforms a sRGB color value to a CIELab color.
131         * This method implements {@link ColorSpace#fromRGB(float[])} assuming
132         * D65-based sRGB color coordinates.
133         * Note that sRGB values are assumed to be in [0,1] (see
134         * {@link RgbUtils#normalize(int...)} for conversion from [0,255] int-values).
135         * @param srgb a sRGB color (D65-based)
136         * @return the associated CIELab color
137         */
138        @Override
139        public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
140                float[] XYZ65 = sRgb65ColorSpace.getInstance().toCIEXYZ(srgb);
141                return fromCIEXYZ65(XYZ65);
142        }
143
144        //CIELab -> sRGB (direct, without adaptation to D50)
145        /**
146         * Transforms a CIELab color value to a sRGB color
147         * This method implements {@link ColorSpace#toRGB(float[])} assuming 
148         * D65-based sRGB color coordinates.
149         * Note that the returned RGB values are in [0,1] (see
150         * {@link RgbUtils#unnormalize(float[])} for conversion to [0,255] int-values).
151         * @param Lab a CIELab color
152         * @return sRGB coordinates (D65-based)
153         */
154        @Override
155        public float[] toRGB(float[] Lab) {
156                float[] XYZ65 = toCIEXYZ65(Lab);
157                float[] srgb = sRgb65ColorSpace.getInstance().fromCIEXYZ(XYZ65);
158                return srgb;
159        }
160
161        //---------------------------------------------------------------------
162
163        private static final double epsilon = 216.0/24389;
164        private static final double kappa = 841.0/108;
165
166        // Gamma correction for L* (forward)
167        private double f1 (double c) {
168                return (c > epsilon) ? Math.cbrt(c) : (kappa * c) + (16.0 / 116);
169        }
170
171        // Gamma correction for L* (inverse)
172        private double f2 (double c) {
173                double c3 = c * c * c; //Math.pow(c, 3.0);
174                return (c3 > epsilon) ? c3 : (c - 16.0 / 116) / kappa;
175        }
176
177}
